intro: Horkelia bolanderi subsp. typica, commonly known as Bolander's horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically hairy and lance-shaped, adapted to the dry, rocky environments it inhabits. It is often found in open, sunny areas such as slopes and gravelly soils in California and Oregon.
